topics.body:
Call me crazy, but I don't get why people say that moe girls are "ruining anime5evar".  If "anime is ruined3evar" wouldn't that mean that is was "ruined" back when it stopped being about art and started being about generating a revenue then?... aka when it was created.

I'll totally admit that Kantai anime was subpar and they fucked it up, but claims about how it's "ruining anime" cause the new thing is moe girls in anime is kind of dumb and such.  Call me crazy, but I think every time a new trend happens in anime that people start saying that it's "ruined forever" or such.




I kind of like moe girls to be honest:
!http://simg3.gelbooru.com//images/33/e8/33e8f1b45b2948665fcebcdb9c3e0662.jpg?1989606!
!http://simg3.gelbooru.com//samples/e9/68/sample_e968d3168ffe772faccc3eab5608d945.jpg?875116!
!http://simg3.gelbooru.com//images/e1/95/e195993303f15057148dc47edf646a6f.jpg?1731696!

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5529b9146368724ca1580500#post_5529b9146368724ca1580500
I don't think that moe girls are ruining anime.
But I _do_ think that shows consisting only of moe girls are really overdone. I'm fine with having moe girls and maybe them as the heroes but it's just really unenjoyable when you notice that the ratio of females to males is 5:1, or how the guys are pretty much stupid in most cases. And no, changing a guy into a moe female does not count. It's like saying that "all guys are dumb and girls rule the world" or something. I also don't like how they makes certain body parts bigger or smaller AND this applies to all characters. The hell is wrong with variation?! No, changing hair color and style does not count either.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976
